recommendations.description: \1 (\1): This annual reaches 30cm and boasts highly ornamental flowers in a mix of lavender, pink, purple, and white hues, some with veined throats in contrasting colours. Plants have a spreading habit and the flowers have a light, sweet scent.
why: Sowable now in cool climate (March, April, August).
Part Sun tolerant; matches your site conditions.
Hardy plant; aligns with your maintenance preference.

sowing.method: penstemon- sensation mixed seeds can be sown directly into the garden or seedlings can be raised in trays or other containers and transplanted to the garden once established

recommendations.description: \1: A compact, globe-shaped radish with pure white skin and interior that grows up to 5cm in diameter. It boasts a mild, juicy, and crunchy texture, making it perfect for adding to salads or stir-fries.
why: Sowable now in cool climate (January, February, March).
Hardy plant; aligns with your maintenance preference.

sowing.method: \1 this means that the seeds are best sown directly into the garden

recommendations.description: _Komatsuna_ (synonyms: _Brassica perviridis_; Also known as "Japanese Mustard Spinach"): This annual leaf vegetable features tall, rounded green leaves with thick, juicy stems. Its mild mustard/cabbage flavor makes it a delightful addition to stir-fries, soups, and salads.
why: Sowable now in cool climate (January, February, March).
Hardy plant; aligns with your maintenance preference.

sowing.method: \1 this means that the seeds are best sown directly into the garden
